meanings.definition: Usual or habitual practices or behaviors
meanings.sent1: In our town, it is the customaries to greet everyone with a smile.
meanings.sent2: The customaries of the family include having dinner together every night.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, the penguins have their own customaries of sliding on their bellies.
meanings.sent4: The customaries of the forest whispered secrets to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The customaries of the playground were etched in the memories of the children.

meanings.definition: A book containing laws and regulations
meanings.sent1: The lawyer referred to the customaries to find the specific legal clause.
meanings.sent2: The library had a section dedicated to customaries from different countries.
meanings.sent3: The customaries on the shelf seemed to have a lively discussion when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The customaries in the courtroom stood as silent witnesses to the proceedings.
meanings.sent5: The customaries on the desk held the wisdom of generations within their pages.

meanings.definition: A fee or tax collected by a government
meanings.sent1: The customaries imposed on imports affected the prices of goods.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper had to factor in the customaries when setting prices for his products.
meanings.sent3: The customaries seemed to play hide and seek with the budget planners.
meanings.sent4: The customaries loomed like shadows over the financial decisions of the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The customaries were like silent partners in the economy, influencing transactions behind the scenes.
